title: wrnet: Regularized win ratio regression through elastic net
text: WRNet is a machine-learning approach to regularized win ratio regression for hierarchical composite endpoints. In the presence of many features, it optimizes feature selection and risk prediction through an elastic net-type penalty on the regression coefficients (log-win ratios).

title: wrnet: Regularized win ratio regression through elastic net
wrnet: Regularized win ratio regression through elastic net
wrnet: Regularized win ratio regression through elastic net
text:
Basics
Comparing two subjects at time \(t\), a winner is the one that has either

longer overall survival, or
longer event-free survival time if both survive past \(t\).

A basic win ratio model is \[\begin{equation}
\frac{P(\mbox{Subject $i$ wins by time $t$})}{P(\mbox{Subject $j$ wins by time $t$})}
=\exp\{\beta^{\rm T}(z_i - z_j)\}.
\end{equation}\]
In the case with a high-dimensional \(z\), a mixture of penalties on the \(L_1\) (lasso) and \(L_2\) (ridge regression) norms of \(\beta\) is imposed to regularize the model.

title: wrnet: Regularized win ratio regression through elastic net

A step-by-step example

Installation
Compile the R functions defined in https://github.com/lmaowisc/wrnet/wrnet_functions.R.

source("wrnet_functions.R")

Two packages that are used extensively by these functions are glmnet and tidyverse.

library(glmnet) # for elastic net
library(tidyverse) # for data manipulation/visualization
